item.title: 10 Mbps, 100 Mbps, 1000 Mbps Internet Upgrades
item.description:
By: John Shepler Are you frustrated with your company’s slow internet speeds? It’s understandable. Today’s applications are much more demanding than the simple websites and text-based emails common when T1 lines were first introduced. A 10 Mbps connection is now the bare minimum for most businesses, and it’s reasonable to need 100 Mbps or even 1000 Mbps. So, how can you upgrade effectively? Upgrading Your Connection One option is to gradually increase your bandwidth as your needs grow...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/10-mbps-100-mbps-1000-mbps-internet-upgrades/

item.title: Do You Still Have Broadband?
item.description:
By: John Shepler Internet broadband speeds have increased significantly in recent times. While a few Mbps was initially considered sufficient, businesses are now rapidly adopting speeds of 100 Mbps and higher, with the FCC setting a 25 Mbps benchmark for broadband. This shift signifies escalating bandwidth demands driven by the increasing reliance on remote resources and the changing nature of online content. What Does The New Standard Represent? The updated broadband standards highlight the growing need for greater bandwidth...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/do-you-still-have-broadband/

item.title: 10 Mbps Is The New T1
item.description:
The longstanding leading connectivity solution for businesses, T1 service, is frequently used for dedicated internet connections, point-to-point private lines, and PBX phone trunks. T1 connections are easily accessible, cost-effective, and very dependable. However, their main selling point—fixed bandwidth of 1.5 Mbps—is now a significant drawback. While 1.5 Mbps still satisfies the needs of many small businesses and less tech-dependent companies, this is changing quickly. Professionals in fields like insurance, medicine, video production, and engineering all require strong connections...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/10-mbps-is-the-new-t1/

item.title: Why 10 Mbps Ethernet is Replacing T1
item.description:
A significant technological shift is affecting small and medium-sized businesses, particularly in how they connect to the internet. The traditional T1 line, a long-time staple, is being phased out and replaced with newer technologies. T1 lines were the first broadband option for businesses, offering a reliable 1.5 Mbps symmetrical bandwidth, a significant improvement over dial-up and slower digital lines. Its initial purpose, developed by Bell Labs, was to carry phone conversations between switching centers...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-10-mbps-ethernet-is-replacing-t1/
